intro: Blakea hispida subsp. stenopetala, commonly known as the woolly blakea, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. The subspecies stenopetala is distinguished by its narrower petals compared to other forms of Blakea hispida.
